Key: I'm home.
Welcome back, Shido. Dinner's ready.

Oh, thanks for taking care of it. Kotori and the others
still cooking?

They're ordering food and doing things here and
there. Kotori-chan said it's important for research...

Seems like their goal is changing drastically... Then
did you eat with the girls, Rinne?

No, not yet. I figured I'd wait for you. And also, I
borrowed Kotori-chan's key... I hope that's not a
problem?

...Oh, I see. Of course it's not. You're always looking
out for us.

(Rinne should have memories of the past. But even
after we reunited, she never once asked for the spare
key.)

(I wonder if I'm assuming too much for thinking that
she's deliberately avoiding the subject.)

Anyways, Shido... Who's the girl behind you that's
staring at me?
Behind me? Oh...

Papa, you're talking too much! How long should Rio
wait?
Oh, sorry Rio. You can come in.
Thank you.
P-Papa? Papa... Shido, what's―
―MAMA!
Huh? What? Mama... Are you talking about me?

Yeah, Mama! Rinne Sonogami, Rio's mama. She's so
nice and really cute.
Um... Should I say thank you?

Yeah. I think that's fine. Rio seems happy to see you,
Rinne.
Today, I spent all day with Papa! It was so fun!
...Shido, can you explain?

Uh, you see... She's Rio Sonogami. She seems to think
I'm Papa and you're Mama.
Shido is Papa... and I'm Mama... huh.

Hey, it's annoying that you're blushing like that. A
good wife shouldn't just leave her guests unattended,
now should she?
Huh?! I'm so sorry... Maria-chan?

Don't talk to me like I'm my little sister. I'm Marina.
Marina Arusu.
Marina...chan?
Don't "chan" me. It gives me the creeps.

Oh... Rinne, this is Maria's older sister. She's kind of
crass, but she's good on the inside, just like Maria.

Hey, I said don't put me in the same category as
Maria! Gosh, Shido Itsuka, are you trying to start a
fight with me?
I have no plans to do that at all, to be honest.
*Giggle*... Hehehe.
What are you laughing about?
No, it just seems like you two are close.
Wh-What?! Shido Itsuka and I aren't close―

Marina, you're always so worried about Papa. And
besides, you two were talking together today! Mama,
Marina, and Papa are friends.
I knew it. I was thinking the same thing, Rio-chan.
Really?! Mama, you really are Rio's mama!

Seems like I can't win against that... It's fine. Then
how about a change of scenery? How long are we going
to just stand here?
You're right. Let's start by coming in, you two.
Okay. Oh, so this is your home, Papa.

Rio-chan. Why don't you sit on the sofa? Shido, I'll
go pour some tea.
Thanks.
...Seems like nothing's happened so far.
It's fine, Marina. I don't think anything will happen.

You can think that all you want, but don't force it on
me.
I wonder if you'd still be like this when you're older...
...Marina?
Nothing. I'm coming in.
Welcome, Marina.
Shido, do you want to eat?

Yeah. Oh, but we might be short since we have more
people, huh?
Oh... I see. What should I do?

All right then, let's make some rice balls. That way,
we can share the main dish and still eat a lot.
Rice balls? Okay, Rio wants to eat rice balls!
Then let me make them. Give me a moment.
Oh, don't worry. You sit, Rinne. I'll make them.

What, but I promised you this morning... That I'd
make dinner...
Yeah, Mama. Mama, sit next to Rio and let's talk.
Okay. Then why don't we talk, Rio-chan.

(Rio bounced up and down on the sofa as she called
for Rinne. Rinne took a seat next to her.)

(Now I need to go to the kitchen to make rice
balls...)
...Marina?

It'll take longer if you're alone, right? Let me help
you.
What's gotten into you?

Gosh, you're so obtuse. It's best to give a mom and
daughter their privacy at a time like this.

...You're right. When it comes to Rio, you seem to
care more about others. You're like her real older
sister.

...That's not it. I'm just playing a role right now.
I'm doing it because I want to. That's all.
Marina... Are you...
(Lonely? I was about to say it, but I stopped.)
(Marina seems lonely, yet she looked satisfied.)

Come on. Let's hurry up and make them. Rio, and
I'm sure you and Rinne Sonogami, are hungry too.
Yeah. Anyways...
...Why are you staring?
Can you cook at all?
..?! Where did all this come from?!

Shido Itsuka... Stop making fun of me. Forget you.
Don't you dare help me with this!

(Marina looked annoyed and walked toward the kitchen.
However, unlike her face, her footsteps were light.
I'm not going to tell her that it made me laugh.)

So I went to a family restaurant for the first time.
I ate so much with Papa!

I see, that's nice. What did you eat with Shido... I
mean, Papa?

Um... I ate a Hamburg steak. And omurice. And meat
sauce!
Wow, amazing. Was it good?

Yeah, it was so yummy! Papa and Maria-onechan were
with me, so it was oh-so delicious.
...Here, it's ready.
Wow, rice balls! Thanks, Marina.

(The rice balls that Marina brought were in a size that
would fit perfectly in Rio's hand.)
Why is Maria "One-chan" and you just call me Marina?
Because... You're not like an older sister, Marina?
Okay, fine. Is that so... Gosh, you're so random.
From what I see, you two act like real siblings.

Don't just say that. You think you're going to fool me
just by smiling like that?
Huh...? I didn't mean it like that...
Hey, Marina?!

I'm sure you're fine with it. As long as you spit out kind
words, no one fights back.
I... didn't mean it like that.

(Marina, just quit it. That's what I wanted to say, but
I couldn't.)

I'm fine with being last. I should just be nice to
everyone. Gosh, you think you're so high and mighty?
Or what, you think this is some kind of repentance?

No, I'm right. You're just scared. Of disappearing from
this world again. And you're worried that Shido will
feel pain because of it.

That's why even when you notice something's off,
you just ignore it and go on living your daily life.
That's just messed up. Wrong. It's ridiculous!
I'm not thinking like that...!

You like that Rio calls you Mama. You even got close
to Maria. Your existence here is totally normal.
You're starting to think, I can be here!""
No... that's not true... I'm not thinking that...

Of course you are. You're the same as me. You
disappear if this world ends. That's all your existence
amounts to.

...I know that. I know that... But what do you want me
to do? What should I have done?!

I told you. You should forget everything and move
towards the future. How about you?
Then Shido... Shido will once again...!
Marina, stop it!
Mama is crying...? So are you, Marina.
How am I crying?
Marina, you're crying.

...Hmph. So you say. Gosh, I really can't deal with
any of you guys.
U-Um... Marina-san, where are you...
...I'm sorry. It seems like Marina has caused trouble.
(The next time she spoke, it was Maria.)
Maria?! What happened to Marina?

Marina is still inside of me. I don't think she'll come
out anymore today.

...To lock herself in, despite having the chance to be
free. You must have struck her where it hurt most.
I see...

(Rio said that Marina was crying, too. I remember what
Marina told me earlier this evening.)

(So she must have been acting tough. She said all
that to Rinne, but in reality, Marina didn't want to
disappear, either. That's why she said that to Rinne.)

(Both what Rinne said and what Marina said... I
understood both so much that it hurt.)
Mama, are you okay?
Yes, I'm fine. But Marina-san is Maria-chan?

No, that's not entirely accurate. It's true that Marina
and I are sharing a body in this world, but our
minds are independent.
I see... Shido, did you know?
Yeah I did. Sorry for not explaining anything to you.

No it's fine. I understand the situation. I'm worried
about Marina-san...

Yeah, I'm worried about Marina, too. Hey, Maria... Do
you retain Marina's memories, too?

Just a little, I would say. However, I can figure out
what happened based on this tension. I'm sorry, Rio.
You were supposed to have fun with your family.

No, it's okay. Mama and Marina are both my family.
I'm happier when they are friends.
Rio... You're such a nice girl.
Does Marina hate Rio now?

No, that's not it. She was just too sensitive to Rio's
words. Anyways, the rice balls are going to get cold.
Oh! *nom, nom*... This is so yummy!
Yes. This must be proof that Marina loves you, Rio.
Yeah! Thanks for the delicious rice balls, Marina!
Rio, saying it now...
No. I'm sure she heard.

(Maria kindly patted Rio's hair. Just like the time she
let Rio sleep on her lap at the park.)
I'm... sorry, Marina-san.
Rinne?

You see, I think I was a bit naïve. I tried not to
think about it. I kept telling myself that the world
wouldn't end. But I realized once Marina-san said it.

I, too, have to come up with my own answers.
Letting Shido or the flow take me away... that's just
me running away from my problems.
Rinne...

Oh... This rice ball is delicious. A different taste from
Shido's, mine, or Maria-chan's...
Rinne...

...Now that I'm done eating, I'm going to head out
now, okay? Good night, Rio-chan, Maria-chan. See you
guys around.
Okay. Good night, Rinne.
...Mama, you can't go.
Rio-chan...?

Marina is gone today. So let's be together until
tomorrow.
Um... What should I do...
If you're okay with it Rinne, I think that's fine.

I see. I will leave it to you, Rinne. Rio doesn't seem
to want to be with me.
That's not true. Rio loves Maria-onechan.

Hehe... I know. But today, you can be with Rinne all
you want.
Okay! Rio is going to sleep with Mama.
Then let's be together today, Rio-chan.
Okay!
Then good night. See you tomo―hm?

(I was going to wave, but Rio had already grabbed my
hand.)
...Rio? Um, you have to let go of my sleeve.
I want to be with Papa, too.
Whaat... I don't know about that...
Family time? We're going to sleep next to each other!
A...haha... What do you want to do, Shido?
Hmm...

(Although this is Rio's request, I don't think I can
sleep with Rinne...)

You don't have to think about it so hard. Just sleep
together.

Huh? W-Wait Maria-chan?! What are you saying...?
Sleep with Shido?!

I've done it before, so I can say for a fact that
nothing will happen. And besides, Rio is small enough
for the three of you to sleep together in one bed.
You did that with Shido while I was gone...
W-Wait. Maria was just in a daze when she came in...
I see... Is that so.
(*Grunt*... Rinne's stare is painful.)
Hey, Papa, Mama? Can we...?
Fine... Only today.
Really?!
H-Hey, Rinne...

(I can't say no since I also did it with Maria. So I
just sighed and nodded.)

Yay! Good one, Maria-onechan! Now I can be with
Papa and Mama today!
Right? Hehehe...
(Maria, your laugh is scaring me.)

Anyways, you want to go to my house? I feel like
Shido's room will be hard to clean up.

Y-Yeah. That's fine, but... it's not like I have anything
suspicious there!

Hehe... I didn't say that. But if you're going to
react like that, maybe you do have something.
S-Seriously, I don't!
Hehe. I'm only kidding.
Then let's go to Mama's home!

All right. We can take a bath together. So then... can
you come by in an hour, Shido?
Got it. An hour from now.

Huh? Papa, Mama, you aren't going to take a bath
together?
We will not!

(Both Rinne and I reacted the same way at Rio's
suggestion.)
(So now we're in bed together, but...)
Hahaha... I-It kinda feels... weird, huh?
Y-Yeah... Doesn't it?

(Rinne and I are sleeping in the same bed... I can't
believe it.―But there's a small being fidgeting
between us.)
Hehe. Papa and mama together. Rio's so happy.
I see, you're happy... That's good.
Papa and Mama, you're warm.

(Rio moved her body between us like she was a little
kitten.)

Papa and Mama, if you guys are far away, it's too
cold. Come close, please.
C-Closer...
Come on Papa, this way!
(Rio yanked my arm.)
Mama, closer too. Okay?
Okay... Rio-chan, you seem so happy.
Yeah. When I'm happy, you smile.

I see. That's right... When you're happy, people smile,
huh...
(Rinne laughed, but she seemed a little sad.)
Rio wants everyone to be happy.
Rio-chan, that's...

Once I find the most important thing, everyone can
be happy, right?

(If Rio finds the most important thing, then Eden―
this fake utopia―will be complete.)

Hey, Rio-chan? Who do you think the happiness
will be for?
Hm? I don't know... Happiness is happiness, right?
Well, Rio...

It's fine, Shido. I'm sure Rio-chan is like I was in
the past.
Rinne... As in when you were the Ruler?
(Rinne nodded gently.)
Hey... Mama, can I ask you something?
Sure. Ask me anything.
Um, Mama... Are you happy?
...I don't know.
...Mama?

(Rinne hugged Rio tightly. I could tell, being right
next to them.)

When you hug me tight Mama, it feels soft. I have
Papa and Mama together... Rio is so happy...
Yeah. Mama is happy, too...
Mama's happy, too... That makes me ha...ppy...
...Good night, Rio-chan.

(Rinne said softly, but it seemed like she was about
to cry. Was I imagining that?)

(Just as I thought, I couldn't fall asleep. Rinne and
Rio were already sleeping. Their peaceful breathing
was synchronized like a real mother and daughter.)

(I'm so glad this wasn't my room. Or else, I might
have given it to her.)
(The "important thing" of hers left in my room.)

This is... proof... that you acknowledged me as
family. As someone important. That's why I absolutely
don't want to lose it... Is that selfish of me?

(And this is what I saw last before coming to this
world. Proof... of family.)

(Does Rinne remember? Maybe she's forgotten...
But even if she did remember... she won't bring it
up.)

(Rio is trying to find the most important thing to
continue this Eden. She believed that was everyone's
happiness.)

(I feel like I was able to understand Rio just a
little bit today. Rio must have been born from Rinne.
From the former Rinne―the Ruler.)

(That's why Rio must be trying to continue this world.
Rinne isn't saying she wants to continue it. No, she
can't. That's why Rio must have been born.)

If that paradise you speak of truly existed...
Then, both good and bad things would end up
unfolding the way I'd want them to.

But... Can you really call that a paradise?!
Can you really be satisfied with such a superficial,
convenient happiness?!

(I remembered a lot of things and kept thinking over
and over. But still, I couldn't find an answer.)

(But I'm a bit lost in this temptation. Maybe I don't
have to choose. I can let time tell. Maybe I'll be fine
with that.)
I can't let that happen.
It's easier if I let that happen.

(No, I can't let that happen. If I don't do anything,
I'll be the one who'll regret it the most.)

(I won't think about it for now... because seeing such
happy sleeping faces makes me think that I too will
feel happiness.)

(I bet you it'll be easier if I let that happen.
I won't have to carry such a heavy burden.)

(But I can't do that. To be the one who takes everyone
else's bright futures away. I can't cut them off with
my choice like Marina says.)

(I'm going to stop thinking for now... I just want to
enjoy this happy moment.)
